title: Total protein in microalgae: Pierce BCA protein assay
title_html: Total protein in microalgae: Pierce BCA protein assay

protocol.title: Total protein in microalgae: Pierce BCA protein assay
protocol.title_html: Total protein in microalgae: Pierce BCA protein assay

source.title: Sample collection

source.description:
Calculate the volume to obtain enough biomass for the assay:

Minimum sampling volume (mL) = 750/(Chl-a_ug/L), if protein is extracted by 500 ul extraction buffer.

source.title: Sample collection

source.description: Use 5 inches Hg to filter microalgae samples onto polycarbonate filters (pore size varies).

source.title: Sample collection

source.description: Fold filter in quarter and place into an MP biomedical bead tube.

source.body:
• Use 2 ml lysing matrix tube for 25 mm filter; 15 ml Teenprep tube for 47 mm filter
  • Large ceramic beads are recommended for diatoms and larger phytoplankton cells (2 mL: MP116913500/ 15 mL: MP116933050)
  • Small yttrium beads are recommended for picoplankton (2 mL: MP116960100/ 15 mL: MP116975050)

source.title: Sample collection

source.description: Flash-freeze tubes in thermo flask with liquid nitrogen

source.title: Sample collection

source.description:
Store at
until further processing

source.title: Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)
Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)

source.description:
In order to obtain compatible results, prepare sufficient PSB so that the same PSB can be used for sample extraction, blank filter extraction and standard solutions
(1) Extract all samples: Each sample requires 0.25 mL PSB
(2) Extract all blank filters: Each filter requires 0.25 mL PSB
(3) Each standard solution (500 ul) requires 0.125 mL PSB

source.title: Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)

source.description: For each 10 g PSB

source.title: Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)

source.description:
Use antistatics weighing dish to weigh the following chemicals:



(1) 0.136 g Tris base


(2) 0.133 g Tris HCl


(3) 0.8 g Lithium dodecyl sulphate

source.title: Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)

source.description: Place a plastic beaker on the top of the scale surface

source.title: Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)

source.description: Remove the cap of a 15 mL tube and sit it in the beaker

source.title: Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)

source.description: Tare the total weight of beaker and tube

source.title: Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)

source.description:
Transfer all chemicals weighed in
into the tube, rinse the dish with small amount of MilliQ water to make certain all of the solutes is transferred into the tube

source.title: Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)

source.description: Use a transfer pipet to add 4 g glycerol into the tube

source.title: Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)

source.description: Add 40 ul 0.5 M EDTA into the tube

source.title: Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)

source.description: Top to 10 g with MilliQ water

source.title: Prepare protein solubilization buffer (PSB)

source.description: Mix by shaker until all solutes are completely dissolved.

source.body: Prepare this solution in advance, since it takes some time to have solutes dissolved, especially LDS.

source.title: Prepare Pefabloc solution

source.body: Pefabloc is a protease inhibitor, and it loses activity over 24 hours.

source.title: Prepare Pefabloc solution

source.description: Add 20.86 mL MilliQ into 100 mg Pefabloc to obtain a final concentration of 20 mM.

source.title: Prepare Pefabloc solution

source.description: Aliquot into 2.5 ml portions and keep frozen at

source.title: Prepare Pefabloc solution

source.description: The solution can be frozen~thawed multiple times.

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description:
Prepare protein extraction buffer (PEB):

Each 1 mL PEB has

250 ul PSB
20 ul 20 mM Pefabloc
730 ul MilliQ water

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description: Prepare ice-bath, keep all samples in the ice-bath

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description: If samples and blank filters are already in bead tubes, add 1 mL PEB onto the filter directly.

source.body: Volume of PEB varies due to the actual biomass collected (see guideline)

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description: If samples are in cryo tubes instead of bead tubes

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description: Rinse forceps with 70% ethanol and air dry

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description:
Add 1 mL PEB onto the filter.
When using 15 mL Teenprep tube, horizontally shake the tube to bury filter into beads before adding PEB, which makes filter easy to be homogenized.

source.body: Volume of PEB varies due to the actual biomass collected (see guideline)

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description: Label bead tubes and use clean forceps to transfer samples and blank filters into its corresponding bead tube.

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description: Turn on FastPrep

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description: Check the cap of each tube to make certain cap is tightly screwed. Organize the tubes in order, take notes of the position of each tube, in case the labels get rubbed out during extraction.

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description: Run 1 min at 6.5 m/s

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description:
Keep tubes
for

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description: Check labels. Put tubes back into FastPrep.

source.description: Run 1 min at 6.5 m/s

source.description: Turn on refrigerated centrifuge

source.description:
Centrifuge:
2 mL Lysing Matrix tubes at

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description: Transfer all supernatant to a 1.7 mL microtube

source.body: For the extraction with 500 ul PEB in Teenprep tube, use 200 ul tip and go straight to the bottom from the side.

source.title: Assay Day 1: Extract protein from microalgae

source.description: Freeze at

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions
Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: Thaw 20 mM pefabloc and transfer 150 ul to a 600 ul mcirotube. Put the rest of the stock back into the freezer immediately.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: Organize eight 1.7 mL microtubes in the tube rack, label the tubes from SD1 to SD8.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: Use 0.5 mL Finntip Stepper Tip to dispense 10 ul pefabloc into each microtube

source.body: Wipe or dab the liquid drop on the outside of the tip, avoid wiping the tip open before dispensing the liquid.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: Use 1.25 mL Finntip Stepper Tip (Thermo Fisher 9404180) to dispense 125 ul PSB into each microtube.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description:
Add MilliQ into each microtube according to the sheet below:
ABCDEF
1 Standard Pefabloc (20 mM) (µL)PSB (µL) MQ (uL) BSA (2mg/mL) (uL) Final Conc. (mg/mL)
2 SD1 10 125 365 0 0
3 SD2 10 125 360 5 0.02
4 SD3 10 125 353 12 0.048
5 SD4 10 125 340 25 0.1
6 SD5 10 125 315 50 0.2
7 SD6 10 125 265 100 0.4
8 SD7 10 125 165 200 0.8
9 SD8 10 125 115 250 1

ABCDEF
1 Standard Pefabloc (20 mM) (µL)PSB (µL) MQ (uL) BSA (2mg/mL) (uL) Final Conc. (mg/mL)
2 SD1 10 125 365 0 0
3 SD2 10 125 360 5 0.02
4 SD3 10 125 353 12 0.048
5 SD4 10 125 340 25 0.1
6 SD5 10 125 315 50 0.2
7 SD6 10 125 265 100 0.4
8 SD7 10 125 165 200 0.8
9 SD8 10 125 115 250 1

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: Break the ampule of BSA standard

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: Reverse pipet certain amount of BSA (2 mg/mL) into each tube according to the sheet

source.body: Wipe or dab the liquid drop on the outside of the tip, avoid wiping the tip open before dispensing the liquid.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: Vortex each tube.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: Dispense 4 uL of each standard solution onto microdrop plate.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: Read absorbance of eight standard solutions at 205 nm

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: Subtract absorbance at 205 nm of blank standard from the 205 nm measurements of all other standard solutions

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: Plot the blank-corrected 205 nm measurement for each standard solution versus its concentration in mg/ml.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare Bovine serum albumin (BSA) standard solutions

source.description: If the standard curve has good Coefficient of Determination, i.e. R2>0.99, the standard solutions are in good quality; otherwise, prepare a new series of standard solutions until the quality of standard solutions passes the screen.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare BCA working reagent (WR)

source.description:
Use the following formula to determine the total volume of WR required. Consider leaving several mL of extra volume since Finntip stepper is unable to expel the entire volume from the tip:

(# standards + # samples + # blank filters) X (# replicates) X (200 ul) = total volume WR required

source.title: Assay Day 2: Prepare BCA working reagent (WR)

source.description: Prepare WR by mixing 50 parts of BCA reagent A with 1 part of BCA Reagent B in a 50 mL falcon tube

source.title: Assay Day 2: Pierce BCA assay

source.description: Turn on incubator and preheat to

source.title: Assay Day 2: Pierce BCA assay

source.description:
Prepare 96-well microplate and lid:
Each microplate can load eight standard solutions and forty samples+blanks, duplicated

source.body: Pipet tip is for single use only.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Pierce BCA assay
Assay Day 2: Pierce BCA assay

source.description: Reverse pipette 25 ul of each standard or sample/blank replicate into the microplate well.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Pierce BCA assay

source.description: Use 2.5 mL Finntip stepper tip to load 200 ul WR, starting from blank, including blank of standard solution and blank of the samples.

source.body: Wipe or dab the liquid drop on the outside of the tip, avoid wiping the tip open before dispensing the liquid.

Dispense WR column by column.
Refill the stepper in between two columns of wells.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Pierce BCA assay

source.description: Cover plate with lid.

source.title: Assay Day 2: Pierce BCA assay

source.description:
Shake and incubate at
for

source.title: Assay Day 2: Pierce BCA assay

source.description: Read absorbance at 562 nm

source.title: Calculate protein content per filter

source.description: Subtract the average 562 nm absorbance measurement of the blank standard replicates from the 562 nm measurements of all other individual standard.

source.title: Calculate protein content per filter

source.description: Subtract the average 562 nm absorbance measurement of the blank sample (filter) replicates from the 562 nm measurements of all other individual sample.

source.title: Calculate protein content per filter

source.description: Prepare a standard curve by plotting the average Blank-corrected 562 nm measurement for each BSA standard versus its concentration in mg/ml.

source.title: Calculate protein content per filter

source.description: Use the standard curve to determine the protein concentration of each unknown sample by using its blank-corrected 562 absorbance.

source.title: Calculate protein content per filter
Calculate protein content per filter

source.description: Protein_mg/filter = Protein_mg/mL X PEB_mL

description:
Here we describe a protocol for extracting total protein from microalgae and quantifying total protein by Pierce BCA protein assay.

https://assets.thermofisher.com/TFS-Assets/LSG/manuals/MAN0011430_Pierce_BCA_Protein_Asy_UG.pdf
